description.narrative: The aim of the one year project was to be a 5-year regionalization strategy that would see the evaluation capacity development (ECD) work of CLEAR-AA achieve the depth and breath that country demand in the region calls for. The three main objectives of the project were: 1) to identify strategic ECD partern in the region 2) to test out CLEAR-AA ECD models and instruments in the region 3) to strengthen CLEAR-AA's learnign from its programmatic work, in oder to feed into applied and academic research

Insatsen avser stöd till Center for Learning on Evaluation and Results - Anglophone Africa (CLEAR-AA) vid University of Witwatersrand i Sydafrika i deras regionaliseringsarbete. Stödet sker i form av ett projekt som blandar fördjupning av valda delar av CLEAR-AAs existerande projekt och program där regionala partnerskap och aktiviteter ingår, samt utforskande av nya partnerskapsformer och verktyg.
Syftet med det globala CLEAR initiativet, där CLEAR-AA ingår, är att stödja kapacitetsutveckling inom utvärdering i Afrika, Latinamerika och Asien via regionala center. I Afrika finns det två; CLEAR-AA för engelsktalande Afrika samt CLEAR-FA för de fransktalande delarna. Att få regional täckning har visat sig svårare än väntat för samtliga center inom CLEAR. Detta gäller även för AA som har blivit en stark aktör inom Sydafrika, men ännu inte lika tydligt utanför. Det är av yttersta vikt att detta arbete stärks så att CLEAR initiativet kan få den relevans som ursprungligen var tänkt regionen, inklusive i bland Sidas programländer. Projektet kommer resultera i en fem-årig regional strategi för CLEAR-AA. Projektansatsen är participativ där en extern facilitator skall stödja CLEAR-AAs ledning och medarbetare i att formulera och förankra strategin baserat på de aktiviteter som ingår i projektet.

The contributions concerns support to the Center for Learning on Evaluation and Results – Anglophone Africa (CLEAR-AA) at University of Witwatersrand in South Africa, w.r.t. their regionalisation work. The support comes in the form of a project that blends deepening of selected parts of CLEAR-AA existing workplan that include regional partnerships and activities related to increased regional coverage, plus exploration of novel partnership formats and tools.
The purpose of the main CLEAR Initiative, of which CLEAR-AA is a part, is to support evaluation capacity development in Africa, Latin America, and Asia through regional centres. Africa host two; CLEAR-AA for anglophone Africa and CLEAR-FA for francophone Africa. The reach regional coverage has proved more challenging than originally envisioned for all CLEAR centres. This holds true also for CLEAR-AA who has become a strong actor within South Africa, but so far not equally strongly beyond. Tis is crucial that this aspect of CLEAR-AA’s work is strengthened for the Initiative to become relevant in the region, which includes a number of Sida partner countries. The project applies a participatory approach where an external facilitator will support the senior management and staff of CLEAR-AA in formulating, test, and internalise a five-year regional strategy and implementation plan based on the activities that are financially supported within the project.

description.narrative: The project was mainly implemented via four components: 1) Strengthening Legislative Oversight (SLO) wich targeted national and regional parliaments. 2) Strengthening Evaluation Capacity (SEC) targeting universities across the region. 3) Strengthening National Evaluation Systems (NES) which coordinated diagnostics studies and comparative analysis of the state and structure of NES:es in the region. 4) The formulation of a 5-year regional strategy Examples of results include a parliamentary oversight online application that was developed and a diagnostics report of the parliamentary contex w.r.t. evaluation in East Africa that was produced. CLEAR-AA also played a role in moving the process of formalizing national evaluation policies forward in Ghana and Tanzania. The regional COMPASS for tracking the evoluation of M&E systems across Anglophone Africa was refined. The CLEAR-AA work in Zambia, South Africa, Ghana and Uganda was signficantly consolidated, while project was pivotal in expanding the work in Kenya, Tanzania and Rwanda in 2018. Entry into other countries such as Lesotho and Mozambique is part of the regional plan. One new M&E degree program was developed by CLEAR-AA's affiliate in Ghana, and 21 universities joined in to build on the collaborative M&E curriculum framework that was developed for the region. The 5-year regional strategy was facilitated, produced and adopted as part of the project.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
